titleStmt.title: A. B. Patrick to Thomas B. Monroe
CWG2387

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Ky JacksonBreathitt CountyDecr 15' 1860
Mr. Thomas B Monroe
Dear Sir

when I was at a few days ago MFrankfort r. Tate informed me that he had issued the commissions the 2nd. time for our County officers Elect at the last august Election I have examined the Post office at this Place & cannot find said commissions I hope you will issue the 3rd. time Coms. for as as Lieutenant Col J. P. & Ota H WarnerCol. A C Cope JP. and direct to me at Jackson Breathitt County Ky by way of Henderson Combs & Chas B McQuinn. I hope you will attend to this immediately as the officers are thinking hard of not geting their coms. soonerMt SterlingHazelgreen

yours
C A. B. PatrickB C C

Breathitt Co
J. P.
H. Combs.
Chas B McQuin
Com Issd Dec 19 1860
